SummaryOfEvents: on 08-10-2023 the recreational craft (RIB) was inbound to berth in the marina with a crew of two and 14 pax onboard. At the pier the fw crew disembark holding the head line and the skipper disembarked holding the stern line. The engine was running and start moving fwd. The vessel climed the pier and fatally hit the skipper. All pax and crew sustain injuries, not serious injuries.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Serious injuries,Ship rendered unfit to proceed

SummaryOfEvents:
During the night on the 14th March 2016, the crew conducting watchkeeping duties in the bridge deck reported to the Captain that there was a total loss of electrical power supply to the navigation equipment.  It was subsequently discovered that intermittent arcing of the electrical circuitry was occurring below the bridge deck in the “Dog House” compartment.  Shortly thereafter, smoke was seen emanating from behind the bulkhead.  In an attempt to find the source of the smoke, the crew conducted fire checks in the galley and below on the main deck in the guest accommodation.  This was to no avail and the search was called off due to the build-up of toxic fumes, and smoke that reduced visibility significantly.   
At approximately 23:20 the decision was taken by the Captain to abandon the MIRACLE.  At about 23:53LT the United States (US) Coast Guard Station in Puerto Rico deployed the US Coast Guard Cutter JOSEPH NAPIER in response to the distress call.  The CG Cutter rendezvous with the stricken crew whom by then were underway in the tender vessel, whereupon they were escorted to the port of ANASCO Puerto Rico and processed by the local authorities.

The Portuguese fv with a crew of 12 sunk due to massive flooding. A SAR operation was deployed by MRCC. The 12 crew were recovered by other fv - belonging to the same owner. The recovering fv proceed to Porto of Vigo, Spain.
Consequences1: Ship rendered unfit to proceed,Total loss of the ship

Location: Indian Ocean (High Seas, 2,700 NM from Australia)
SummaryOfEvents: On Wednesday, 17 May 2023, a Chinese fishing vessel Lu Peng Yuan YU 028 en route from Cape Town (South Africa) to Busan (Republic of Korea) capsized in the Indian Ocean at around 3am in local time. The vessel with 39 crews onboard were still missing and none of the crew has yet been found. China’s leader Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Li Qiang have ordered Chinese diplomats abroad to assist in the search for survivors.

Two crew members have died and one is missing after a fire broke out on M/T Kristin towards 
her bow, carrying fuel to terminals on the Indonesian islands of Bali and Lombok. 
The chartered vessel, MT Kristin, had 17 crew on board and was carrying 5,900 kilolitres of fuel 
when the fire started at 2:50 p.m. local time (0650 GMT) on Sunday.
No oil spills were detected after the fire  around the ship. The vessel was being towed to the nearest safe port.

On 21 March, Mt SEASONG was underway in the Channel/La Manche, inward towards Skagen, Denmark. Fv O.231-DEN HOOPE was sailing in the same area, following fishing tracks crossing the recommended TSS just in front of Greenwich light vessel. This is an area between two manadatory TSS in the Channel. When mt SEASONG approached , fv O.231-DEN HOOPE was fishing with a heading towards the French coast. Around 1053 fv O.231 DEN HOOPE turned around and changed her track towards the UK coast. Consequently, she came on collision course with mt SEASONG, TCPA 1102. Mt SEASONG turned to PS to avoid a collision.FV O.231-DEN HOOPE turned to SB to avoid collision. Mt SEASONG could not avoid the PS beam (trawl gear) of fv O.231 DEN HOOPE. After the collision, fv O.231 DEN HOOPE returned to Oostende by her own means and with a damaged beam. Mt SEASONG continued her course.

20.02.2023 Port Belfast Vessel stayed starboard side alongside under cargo operations. AB was on duty to watch loading of containers on Bay 12 with hand held VHF. At 22:45 It AB 1 doesn't response on the VHF call. AB 2 and OS 1started to search for AB1 . At 22:50 OS1 detected man over board on port side of the vessel without signs of life. At 22:58 It AB1 recovered from the water and hospitalized where he passed away.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Ship remains fit to proceed

SummaryOfEvents: on 20-02-2023 the vessel was engaged in a maritime truistic excursion with a crew of two and 33 pax on board. there was a flooding in the engine room and the vessel start to sunk. the skipper give order to abandon vessel. The crew and pax were recovered by other recreational crafts and by the maritime police. there were no injuries. the vessel was partial submerse and was towed to a shipyard.

On 18/01/2022 around 2200, the 3/O and the SMS trainer on board were filling the air bottles of the lifeboat with compressed air, up to 200 bar. The 3/O was operating the compressor and the SMS trainer was inside the lifeboat. Communication was done by VHF hand held radio. After finishing the third and last bottle, the hose was depressurized. The SMS trainer was inside the lifeboat and was closing one of the valves when suddenly the connection came off and hit the SMS trainer in his right eye.
